quest.name: Finding Your Voice
journal:
Ardashir has made a breakthrough in his study of the anima.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

Ardashir is determined to supplement the anima's aetheric energies so that it might relay its thoughts clearly and concisely. To that end, he proposes improving the aetherial conductivity of the weapon not only to give the anima the strength to converse, but to allow those without the Echo to comprehend that which is communicated. Gerolt begrudgingly agrees to assist. To work on the anima weapon, however, he must first insulate his tools with a soulglaze, and for that he requires five pots of aether oil. He bids you seek out Eorzea's traders of ancient antiquities to procure what he requires.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

You return with pots of aether oil in hand to find Gerolt in unusually high spirits. He soon reveals the reason for his good mood, namely that he has, in fact, consumed a large volume of spirits. Deaf to Ardashir's plea to lower his hammer, Gerolt begins pounding away with surprising speed and precision. It is not long before his work is complete and you take up a weapon seemingly alive with aether. As you raise it high to bask in its warm glow, the anima suddenly manifests itself to you. It is thankful for its newfound strength, and vows to do what it can to aid you in your coming adventures. Though he cannot yet perceive the anima, Ardashir is glad to see you sharing such a lengthy exchange, and looks forward to seeing how the anima will take shape under your guidance.
objectives: With Almace and AncileVerethragnaUkonvasaraRhongomiantGandivaMajestasHvergelmirDraconomiconTetrabiblosKannagiArmageddonNothungDeneb in your inventory, deliver the pots of aether oil to Ardashir.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We have made remarkable progress, Forename, but our work is far from over.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: If we are to create a truly freethinking weapon, we must empower the anima to do more than utter a few unintelligible words to its wielder.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text:
Moreover, it must be encouraged to recognize you not only as the rightful owner of the weapon, but also as a companion to whom it can turn for guidance.
...A companion who senses its presence where no other can.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Quite why that should be is a question which confounded me for some time.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: It was only after spending countless days poring over my notes that the answer came to me. In my efforts to predict the anima's rate of growth, I realized that I had overlooked an important variable─you, my friend. Which is why I took the liberty of investigating you and your dealings in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: You are possessed of a rare power known to some as the “Echo,” are you not?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I have read that it conveys a preternatural sensitivity to the psyches of others. And what is the anima but a nascent psyche?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer sayin' ye've got to have special powers just to see the bloody thing?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...Special powers what only a handful o' folks've got. Well, that's just great, that is. Even if Forename an' herhis Echo-sportin' mates buy ten weapons each, they ain't like to spend the sums Rowena's got in mind, meanin' me debts are set to go unpaid. Unless, o' course, ye've thought of a solution?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, I have!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Unlike the quasi-souls of golems and other constructs, the anima is unique in that it was created using the pure aetherial energies of astral and umbral nodules. As such, it bears no residual imprint of another psyche, and therefore possesses the potential for cognizance and growth.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Having no reason or desire to grow, golems can typically subsist almost indefinitely on the energy of their initial aetherial infusion.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: The anima, however, is quite different. Being in a state of constant development, it requires a constant supply of aether. And while it is capable of sustaining itself by drawing upon the naturally occurring aether of its immediate surroundings, I have theorized that the cause of its marked growth to this point is, in fact, its close proximity with you, Forename.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Your weapon serves as a conduit between you and the anima, feeding it energy at a steady, albeit slow, pace. If we could somehow improve the weapon's conductivity, I am certain it would promote faster growth, enhancing the anima's ability to communicate.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But that is not all. Should we improve the conductivity sufficiently, the resultant strengthening of the connection between anima and wielder could, in theory, facilitate communication even in the absence of the Echo─felling two birds with but a single stone.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Which is where you come in, Gerolt. Do you think you can improve the aetherial conductivity of our anima's lodgings?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph. I can't bloody well say no now, can I?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon I should be able to get the aether flowin' a bit freer between Forename and the anima, but it'll come at a cost.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: By improvin' the weapon's conductivity, it'll become extra sensitive to anyone touchin' it, and that includes me when I'm poundin' on it with me hammer. My energies pourin' into the anima could muddle up whatever relations Forename's already got with it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I mean, if the bloody thing was to take after me instead of old Forename here...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, I will not deny that taking after a man of your...character could certainly prove problematic. But how would you go about preventing such contamination?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Contamination!? Cheeky little shite! Any anima'd be lucky to take after me! Just not this one, on account o' how it's Forename's. Don't go worryin' yer pretty little head, anyway, 'cause unlike you, I think my plans through.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's a matter o' makin' me tools impassible to aether, in case yer wonderin'. Luckily, I've done summat similar before. While I was workin' with another annoyin' scholarly type, we developed a little trick called “soulglazin'.” It's used to insulate weapons, but me tools shouldn't be no different.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: ...'Course, I didn't actually make the soulglaze meself, but I've got a fair idea what might stand in fer it. Accordin' to a glowin' ball I was talkin' to, the Allagans used summat called “aether oil” in their metalworkin', an' it did pretty much the same job.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's sure to be rare, expensive, or a bit o' both, but ye've got experience with this sort o' thing, don't ye lasslad?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So run along an' find us five pots of aether oil fer me hammer an' anvil, will ye? We're none of us gettin' any younger.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: ...I am, of course, grateful to you for identifying a solution. It is but a pity you did not think to ask this glowing ball of yours where to acquire it. Mayhap next time you could think your plan through a little more, yes?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: I apologize for this gross imposition, but I fear we must have that aether oil if we are to proceed.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In the meantime, Gerolt and I will continue researching how best to foster the anima's development.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. I take it you are ready for the next step in nurturing yet another young anima.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Then we must apply another coating of soulglaze to Gerolt's tools that he may safely work on the anima's vessel.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: As you may recall, the process calls for five pots of aether oil. I know not where you acquired them before, but I must ask that you do so again. We will have made the necessary preparations by the time you return.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: We shall set to work as soon as you return with the aether oil. It is five pots we require, don't forget. Oh, and do remember to bring the weapon itself. We shall struggle to proceed without that!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must have [Error] and [Error] in your inventory to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Was I not clear? If we are to improve the anima weapon's conductivity without exposing the poor thing to Gerolt's...character, we need five pots of aether oil.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well done, friend. While you were abroad acquiring these, we saw to the rather less onerous matter of our own preparations.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: In the process, we happened upon an archive with a particularly riveting selection of texts on aetherochemical research that may well prove useful in the future.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Alas, I was only able to steal a few cursory glances at their contents as Gerolt was intent upon sneaking off to drown himself in ardent spirits. <sigh> Would that he were as keen to immerse himself in his work...

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well done, friend. Preparations went fairly smoothly in your absence...despite Gerolt's best attempts to lose himself in his cups.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Pious little prick. A young'un like you wouldn't understand. It's me muse...me inspiration! All me best ideas come after downin' summat strong.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Is that right? Then what a pity you abstained for as long as you did. Had you only been a little more inebriated, mayhap you would have devised a plan which didn't involve putting Forename to such trouble.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Shut yer gob an' coat me anvil with that aether oil before I crack one o' them pots over yer head.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: There. Applying the oil was much easier than I expected. How did you fare with your hammer?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She's oiled up an' ready fer action. There's no tellin' how long the coatin'll last, though. Time to get poundin'!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Please do be careful, Gerolt. Forename went to great lengths to procure that oil. I would not have herhim go to all that trouble again through any error on our part.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think yer forgettin' who yer talkin' to, lad. My only error's makin' weapons what're too good fer their owners─present company excepted o' course. Besides, I downed a bottle o' the good stuff not long ago. Never felt better!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Well, I am glad to hear─

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Wait, did you say a bottle? A whole bottle!? Seven hells, man! I cannot in good conscience allow you to work in your condition!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah! Don't be so daft. It weren't bad stuff. 'Least I don't think it was. I found it when ye were readin'─hic!─all about them aether-comical wossnames.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, there's only one way to find out how good it really was. It's─hic!─hammerin' time!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now stand back, and let the─hic!─master get to work!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: How...how is that possible? Such swift, precise movements. And his eyes─never have I seen them so sharp. Is he quite certain it was alcohol he drank and not some manner of invigorating tonic?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: No matter how many times I see it, I fail to comprehend how alcohol can inspire a man to work with such vigor.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: This is not the drunkard I imagined when Rowena introduced us. Mayhap...mayhap we should keep another bottle on hand. In case he should be required to craft something else, I mean.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Truly the realm's most peculiar blacksmith.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There! A taste o' me true talents. Next time, maybe ye'll believe old Gerolt when he tells ye about the redeemin' power of a stiff drink.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now then, Forename. Hold her up and see how she feels. Like an extension o' yer armsarm, I'll bet, what with the aether flowin' so free.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A genuine, bona fide bleedin' masterpiece fashioned for the realm's greatest adventurer by her greatest livin'─hic!─blacksmith...[Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Genuine, bona fide bleedin' masterpieces fashioned for the realm's greatest adventurer by her greatest livin'─hic!─blacksmith...[Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Magnificent! Simply magnificent! You can almost feel herhis aetherial energies coursing through themit. What effect do you suppose this will have on the anima?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: I feel at peace. I feel...myself. You would share your aether─the very essence of your being─to lend me strength?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Then I, for my part, shall do all in my power to lend you strength in turn, and together we shall explore the realm as comrades. That is, if you will have me...?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: So warm...

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: At last I feel...myself. You would share your aether─the very essence of your being─to support me?

dialogue.name: BUKINOSEIREI
dialogue.text: Then I, in turn, shall do all that I can to support you, going wheresoever you go, even unto the farthest reaches of the realm. If, that is, you will take me as your companion...?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Forename...? I take it the anima has spoken with you once again?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: That was a comparatively lengthy exchange, was it not? Far longer, certainly, than the scant whispers you described before. This is progress, my friend! Tangible progress! Should our young charge continue to develop at this rate, it may not be long before Gerolt and I can converse with it! At last, our goal of a freethinking weapon is within reach!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Impressed, are ye? Well, the anima weapon's just the start. Feast yer eyes on this little beauty!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: While Forename was off lookin' fer aether oil, I went fer a little wander and this thing found me─I mean, I found it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, seein' as there ain't much these Allagan contraptions can't do, I gave it a recipe for makin' spirits. And let me tell ye, the thing's got a real knack for─hic!─followin' instructions.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With a bit o' work, I reckon we could probably teach it how to make weapons what look like the anima weapon by the bleedin' dozen!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: They won't be real anima weapons, o' course, on account o' there bein' no spirit inside, but ye can be sure they'll still sell. And seein' as how ye helped me get here, I'll even let you have one half-price. Can't say fairer than that, eh?

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Have you no decency!? We did not come here to fashion trinkets. We came here to imbue weapons with life! Life that should be respected!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Respectin' life don't come into it. I came here to pay off me debts, remember. An' if that means makin' a few trinkets, I'll bloody well make 'em. Like it or not, where there's muck, there's money, an' I mean to─hic!─take it.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: <sigh> Drinking may have served to steady your arm, but I see your moral compass remains as wayward as ever. Plainly, there are limits to even alcohol's miraculous powers.

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: But let us set aside Gerolt's scheming for the present. Today marks an important malmstone in our collective journey─and in your journey especially, Forename. The bond you share with the anima is stronger than ever. Teach it well, and one day soon the world will look upon the brilliance of our anima weapon and wonder!

dialogue.name: ARDASHIR
dialogue.text: Today marks an important malmstone in our collective journey─and in your journey especially, Forename. You have successfully strengthened your bond with another anima. Teach it well, and one day soon the world will look upon the brilliance of our anima weapons and wonder!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your anima weapon is now hyperconductive, fortifying your bond with the spirit within!
